title: What She Lost

Lena_Martinez.emotional_state: Grief, trauma resurfacing, recognizing Adrian is gone
Lena_Martinez.trauma: Father's schizophrenia mirrors Adrian's transformation - same loss, different cause
Lena_Martinez.crisis: Cannot distinguish transformation from delusion, cannot save him
Lena_Martinez.warning_sign: Geometric patterns starting at edge of consciousness - Stage 1 beginning
knowledge: He feels nothing for her anymore
She may be transforming due to her research and contact
Lena_Martinez.choice_approaching: Transform or resist when dreams fully manifest

Adrian_Keller.emotional_state: Clinical observation, viewing Lena as 'loose end' for strategic closure
Adrian_Keller.demonstration: Shows Lena he's completely posthuman - no emotional connection remains
transformation_markers: Sees Lena as pattern and process
Treats conversation as strategic necessity not emotional need
Warns her about potential transformation without caring about outcome

planted_elements.planted_for: Chapter 37 - her choice to expose herself or not

planted_elements.element: Father's schizophrenia as parallel to Change
planted_elements.planted_for: Lena's inability to trust transformation is real

themes_touched: Love insufficient to bridge posthuman transformation
Trauma coloring perception - delusion versus transcendence indistinguishable
Human cost of transformation - those left behind
atmosphere: Grief, helplessness, parallel to father's loss, warning of future transformation
key_images: Adrian's empty apartment - no personality remaining
His eyes seeing through her to code underneath
Lena crying while Adrian observes clinically
Geometric patterns starting in her consciousness
Rain falling as she walks away
foreshadowing: Complete severance between human and posthuman
